techmeme.title: Take-Two reports Q1 net bookings up 1% YoY to $1.22B, vs. $1.25B est., net revenue up 4%, and expects sequential growth in net bookings in FY 2026 and FY 2027 (Zaheer Kachwala/Reuters)
Q&A with DOJ antitrust boss Jonathan Kanter on the US' Google win, the Apple deal, competition, being "overjoyed", Google's appeal, market definitions, and more (Nilay Patel/The Verge)
Spotify says Apple's new "unacceptable" plan "disregards the fundamental requirements" of EU's DMA; Tim Sweeney calls it "malicious compliance" with "junk fees" (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Sources: Japanese cybersecurity company Trend Micro, which has a market value of about $6.5B, is exploring a sale after attracting buyout interest (Milana Vinn/Reuters)
Putin signs a law legalizing cryptocurrency mining in Russia; only Russian legal entities and individuals included in a register will have the right to mine (TASS)
